issues.text: difficulties relating to the interpretation and inter-relation of ss. 31, 88 and 89 of the 1948-Act

anchor.surface_text: This appeal was first heard by a Division Bench of this Court and has been referred to a larger Bench in view of certain difficulties relating to the interpretation and inter-relation of ss. 31, 88 and 89 of the 1948-Act and in view of two decisions of this Court in Sakharam v. Manikchand 1  and Mohanlal Chunilal Kothari v. Tribhovan Haribhai Tamboli  2 .

precedents.cited_proposition: Sections 88 and 89(2)(b) of the 1948-Act do not take away the status of protected tenant acquired under the 1939-Act for lessees from local authority
precedents.cited_holding: provisions of s. 88 were entirely prospective and were not intended to be confiscatory; s. 89(2)(b) conserves rights acquired before 1948-Act

precedents.cited_proposition: Section 88(1)(d) of the 1948-Act applies retrospectively and considerations apply equally to s.88(1)(a)(b)(c); affects protected tenant status under 1939-Act
precedents.cited_holding: S. 88(1)(d) would be rendered completely ineffective if not applied retrospectively
